content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Below is the solution written in Julia programming language using DataFrames package for data manipulation. This function will add a new column 'ym' to your DataFrame `df`. 

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((x)->Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```

How to use it:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
df = DataFrame(dt=Date[])
push!(df, (Date("2001-02-03"),)) # add some dates
add_yearmonth(df)
```
After running the function `add_yearmonth` on your data frame with DateTimes in 'dt' column, you will have a new integer column 'ym', which is year and month concatenated into one integer.
